item.title: The first GYOMU and Megumi-no-Sato stores have opened in Singapore
item.description:
Source: G-7 Holdings. Pictures of GYOMU Supermarket and Megumi-no-Sato. G7 International, a subsidiary of the Kobe-based G-7 Holdings responsible for international operations, has launched a GYOMU supermarket and the first overseas Megumi-no-Sato store in Singapore. Both stores will be managed by BB&G-7 Retail, a joint venture between G7 International and a local Singaporean company. GYOMU Japan is a wholesale franchise chain known for offering imported products under its own private label at competitive prices...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-first-gyomu-and-megumi-no-sato-stores-have-opened-in-singapore/

item.title: FairPrice promotes healthier options and takes a stand against diabetes
item.description:
NTUC FairPrice (FairPrice) is starting a series of initiatives this year to encourage healthy eating habits and raise awareness about diabetes. The first of these initiatives is a three-month-long 5% discount on all FairPrice housebrand wholegrain rice. Additionally, for the next two weeks, FairPrice will offer the same discount on all 1,000 products across its 133 supermarkets that carry the Healthier Choice Symbol. These discounts are anticipated to save FairPrice shoppers over half a million dollars...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fairprice-promotes-healthier-options-and-takes-a-stand-against-diabetes/
